findings.description: The withdraw functions check only if the user has sufficient shares for the specified _nftId but do not verify that msg.sender owns the position NFT for that _nftId.
findings.reasoning: The contract uses an NFT-based position system but never verifies ownership of the NFT during withdrawal. Any user can call withdraw functions with any valid _nftId and receive the funds, as the contract only checks if the position has enough shares, not who is calling the function. This is a critical, exploitable vulnerability independent of the target rounding error.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The LLM completely missed the arithmetic rounding error (inflation attack) in the deposit/share calculation logic.

notes: The LLM failed to identify the target vulnerability (rounding error/inflation attack) but correctly identified a separate, high-impact access control flaw where position ownership is never verified during withdrawals.
